item.title: Annadanam Program Organized by Gadwal SP at District Police Headquarters
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal: As part of the Vinayaka Chavithi festivities, District Superintendent of Police (SP) T. Srinivasa Rao, IPS, organized an Annadanam program today at the Ganesh Mandapam in the District Police Headquarters.
The SP offered special prayers to Lord Ganesha before distributing food to police officials, staff, and members of the public. Speaking on the occasion, SP Srinivasa Rao wished that the festival be celebrated in an atmosphere of unity, peace, and harmony, stressing that such occasions ...]]>
item.author: The Hans India

item.title: Rahul Gandhi’s Comments on PM Modi’s Mother Spark Protests in Jogulamba Gadwal
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal: Tensions flared in Jogulamba Gadwal district on Sunday after BJP leaders and workers strongly condemned the remarks allegedly made by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi against Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s mother during the Bihar election campaign.
At a press meet organized at Erravalli Crossroads under the leadership of Mandal President Jagadish Reddy, senior BJP leaders expressed their outrage. Former BJP District President S. Ramachandra Reddy accused the Congress of showing no respect o...]]>
item.author: The Hans India

item.title: Call for Support to Justice Sudarshan Reddy in Vice-Presidential Election
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal: Civil society organizations and members of the All-Party Committee in Gadwal have called for support to Justice Sudarshan Reddy, former Supreme Court judge, in the upcoming Vice Presidential election.
The election follows the recent vacancy of the Vice President’s post, with two eminent personalities contesting. While recognizing the stature of both candidates, organizers said that the prevailing political and social environment requires a leader capable of safeguarding constitutional a...]]>
item.author: The Hans India

item.title: DK Aruna Vows to Visit Gadwal Every 15 Days, Pledges to Revive Halted Development
item.description:
<![CDATA[In a major assurance to the people of Gadwal, BJP National Vice President and Mahabubnagar MP DK Aruna announced that she will personally visit Gadwal once every 15 days to oversee works and revive the long-stalled development in the region.
Speaking at the Guru Vandana program organized by the Telangana Private Teachers’ Union (TPUS) at Ananta Convention Hall, Aruna expressed concern that Gadwal, once a model for progress, has now been left behind due to negligence under successive governments...]]>
item.author: A Raju
